page.title: 09INDUSTRY
page.content: Apart from the holiday camps a great proportion of the prosperity of Camber depends on the day visitors and weekend campers. The man who runs the trampolines and bouncing castle hires out windbreaks and deckchairs; the beach cafes, gift shops and amusement arcades are all largely dependent on the day visitors, as of course are the car parks. Even the grocers, post office and general stores, the garage and the public houses need a large influx of visitors in order to enable them to survive the lean winter months. Most of the businesses are family run, employing a few people and casual labour in the summer. The holiday camps employ seasonal staff, with a few personnel to maintain the sites during winter, and a small amount of building.
